Node Class Reference
[Hierarchical graphics library]

#include <Node.h>

Inheritance diagram for Node:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Base class for all objects in scene graph.

Node contains model transformation and object hierarchy information. Note that even though nodes are reference counted, references to parent are weak, i.e. parent can be destroyed even though child is still referenced by the user. In that case the child is automatically unlinked from the parent.


Public Types

enum  NodeClassId {
  NODE_OTHER = (0<<4), NODE_CAMERA = (1<<4), NODE_CONSOLE = (2<<4), NODE_DUMMY = (3<<4),
  NODE_LIGHT = (4<<4), NODE_SCENE = (5<<4), NODE_FIRST_VISUAL = (6<<4), NODE_LINES = (6<<4),
  NODE_MESH = (7<<4), NODE_OTHER_VISUAL = (8<<4), NODE_PARTICLESYSTEM = (9<<4), NODE_LAST_VISUAL = (9<<4),
  NODE_USERCLASSID_1 = (12<<4), NODE_USERCLASSID_2 = (13<<4), NODE_USERCLASSID_3 = (14<<4), NODE_USERCLASSID_4 = (15<<4)
}

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Node::NodeClassId

Node class identifier.

Used by the implementation to avoid depending on RTTI, since this class might be need to be ported to some platforms which do not support run-time type information.

Enumerator:
NODE_OTHER  Node is either plain node or unknown derived class.

Default type.

NODE_CAMERA  Node is Camera.

NODE_CONSOLE  Node is Console.

NODE_DUMMY  Node is Dummy.

NODE_LIGHT  Node is Light.

NODE_SCENE  Node is Scene.

NODE_FIRST_VISUAL  First class id of Visuals.

NODE_LINES  Node is Lines.

NODE_MESH  Node is Mesh.

NODE_OTHER_VISUAL  Node is Visual, but not Mesh or ParticleSystem.

NODE_PARTICLESYSTEM  Node is ParticleSystem.

NODE_LAST_VISUAL  Last class id of Visuals.

NODE_USERCLASSID_1  The first of the class IDs reserved to the user application.

NODE_USERCLASSID_2  The second of the class IDs reserved to the user application.

NODE_USERCLASSID_3  The third of the class IDs reserved to the user application.

NODE_USERCLASSID_4  The fourth of the class IDs reserved to the user application.

enum Node::NodeFlags

Enumerator:
NODE_ENABLED  Node enabled flag.

Exact usage semantics is dependent on derived class.

NODE_LIGHTTYPE  Light type mask for Light class instances.

NODE_LIGHTTYPE_SHIFT  Shift needed to access light type.

NODE_CLASS  NodeClassId of this Node.

Default is NODE_OTHER.

NODE_BOUNDWORLDSPACE  Set if Node's bounding volumes are stored in world space coordinates.

NODE_DEFAULTS  Default type flags for Node.

virtual Node* Node::clone (  )  const [virtual]

Returns clone of this node.

Clones child nodes as well.

Reimplemented in Camera, and Scene.

int Node::depth (  )  const

Returns depth of the hierarchy at specified node.

If the node has no parent then the depth if 0, if single parent then depth is 1, etc.

Node* Node::next ( const Node *  root  )  const

Iterates through the scene graph hierarchy.

This function can be used to enumerate all objects in the scene graph under given root. Iteration is performed in child-first-then-sibling order. Note that to iterate throught the scene graph the return value of this function must be used to ask for next node.

Parameters:
root Iteration root. Must be != 0.

Sets node enabled/disabled.

Disabled nodes are ignored in rendering (both lights and visuals).
